Import Libraries


Code
# import libraries
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go

title: The Brewery Project - Information Page
text:
Matplotlib Example


Code
# matplotlib example
plt.scatter(data = df, x = 'total_bill', y = 'tip')

title: The Brewery Project - Information Page
text:
Seaborn Example


Code
# seaborn example
sns.scatterplot(data = df, x = 'total_bill', y = 'tip')

title: The Brewery Project - Information Page
text:
Plotly Example


Code
# plotly example
fig = px.scatter(df, x='total_bill', y="tip", color='time',
                 symbol='sex', size='size', facet_row='day',
                 facet_col='time')
 
fig.show()

title: The Brewery Project - Information Page
text:
Plotly Interactive Example


Code
# plotly interactivity example I
plot = go.Figure(data=[go.Scatter(
    x=df['day'],
    y=df['tip'],
    mode='markers',)
])
 
# Add dropdown
plot.update_layout(
    updatemenus=[
        dict(
            type="buttons",
            direction="left",
            buttons=list([
                dict(
                    args=["type", "scatter"],
                    label="Scatter Plot",
                    method="restyle"
                ),
                dict(
                    args=["type", "bar"],
                    label="Bar Chart",
                    method="restyle"
                )
            ]),
        ),
    ]
)
 
plot.show()

Tab for our Introduction!

Do not include anything about models or methods, datasets, etc. This area is only about the topic, what it is, why it matters, who it affects, what has been done so far, what can still be done. etc. You must also include ten questions that you seek to answer based on your dataset. This is a MUST. Ensure questions make sense and relate to real-life.
